review: Had a great experience learning under him.
Anil Sir wasn't so interactive but he helped us grasp the basics of discrete mathematics and graph theory.ðŸ˜„

The suprise quizzes were helpful in maintaining 100% attendance and mini quizzes ensured prep every week. This was sufficient for scoring good in exams.ðŸ˜‡

Although some his hand written notes were hard to decrypt if you didn't listen in the class.ðŸ¥²
It was very good experience while doing this course under him
Don't be disappointed if you do bad in weekly quizzes every exam matters but even if some go bad can always make it better by the end. Can do good just by reading the slides.

ESC201 by Imon is the best course I have ever taken. His slides are sufficient for a decent grade but do try attending classes because he loves giving surprise quizzes! The tutorial mini quizzes keep you on your toes as well. Overall, it was a really nice experience and this course was more like an intro to "engineering" for me. Hoping to take more courses under him :)

No attendance policy and the slides were enough and medium paced to have 
a better understanding for the students . You do need to do a lot of practice to do well in the quizzes .

Dasgupta's textbook was a strong reference for this course and reading that was more than enough to do decent. Whenever I had doubts, I went to his office and he answered them in a nice interactive manner. However he had a VERY strict attendance policy, and then implemented binary grading in the end, where a  lot of people got even 0 in the endsems!

He always has a high energy  in the class and wants to share every bit of possible information to the class which can be useful to the students in any way, he also tries to get the whole class attention by telling some russian stories or some stories which are completely out of context like some random discussion on literacy or common cold  . He tries to get the review of students after each class to know if he can improve his teaching methods in the coming classes and he writes the names of students who ask a doubt or discuss something related to the course in the board like giving special mentions , (everyone wants that ig)
Very difficult course under him, the lectures were hard to follow if you happened to miss a few in the beginning, had a reputation of bad grading but this time he graded well!

I took EE200 under him. He is a cute professor. He does not interact much with the class but that's what makes his "Should we have a surprise quiz today, class?" funnier. I have attended n-5 of his classes, and he coincidentally (or intentionally) had kept a surprise quiz on all the days I did not attend (which was funny during the sem but not when the grades came TT). 

Moreover, he explains well if you ask him a doubt after class, but his classes are monotonous hence it's hard to stay focused.  His slides are good but make sure to read "Signals & Systems by Alan Oppenheim" too since quizzes are directly based on them.

Speaking about exams, he is a creative guy - our midsem was completely random, i don't think any reference book has those questions. It tested all the right concepts but in very creative ways. Try taking a look at it, he might not repeat them, but I personally had a lot of fun solving it.

Great course and great implementation, slides were useful and the labs too, but courses like TA111 are highly dependent on ur alloted TA, for ne it went great. Labs helped a lot over the lectures, but it's important to get good attendance :)

He took the course till the midsem. He was very interactive in the classes and took a lot of surprises quizzes(just basic questions using the concept taught in that class) so you need to be present in the classes (not to mention it was easy to cheat during the surprise quizzes)
A nice guy who genuinely wants his students to learn what he's teaching.

Tough course but he made it simple to understand with good lecture slides that u can revise with. Attending the classes definitely helped do better, and suprise quizzes motivated us to attend the classes. The midsems were so different compared to what was thought however, it was completely intuitive and difficult

He took the second half of ee200 for our batch (first half was taken by Tushar Sandhan). Personally, I liked Tushar better. Naren put his efforts to teach but he was not good at engaging the class. It was better to study directly from the book or the other tutor, Tushar's slides. He did good grading though.
He was good in everything , I didn't study and got F grade.

The professor is very friendly and easy to talk to. 
He is very understanding and has sufficient knowledge of his work. Like in my project he always helps me with the work and answers all my questions even when they are silly and provides a complete solution. 
In my project he is literally helping us from the basic like teaching what are nlp and llm and then telling us how we can extract data and how we are going to work upon them.
He is also not very strict with his work.
gradeortopic: Automated Extraction of Synthesis Data from Unstructured Scientific Literature

review: Quizzes and endsem paper was tough and  the grading scheme was strict.
Very nice port if you listen properly

It was a difficult course, and the professor wanted all students to attend classes and take notes while he taught. I struggled in the second half of EE200 and was worried about getting a very bad grade, given his strict grading in previous courses. However, before the end-semester exam, I studied from a reference book, which helped me significantly and improved my grade a little I think and he graded this course well

Prof was strict about decorum of class and lateness. Taught by writing on the board and u were required to make notes during the class. Teaching style and pacing was good, quizzes were easy but midsem and endsem were harder.

The class is very boring and he doesn't teach that well , i mean he tries to explain everything but attending the lectures were not helpful  (after all he was taking the course for the first time ) everyone just came to class for attendance . His grading was good but taking the course to learn something was a bad idea.
Taught unnecessary topics and didnâ€™t emphasise enough on important topics. Course is very fast paced.

He grades fine but his C+ range is very wide so even though I did way above average, I still got a C+.  He is enthusiastic about answering doubts. His lectures are not interesting, and it was not necessary to listen to them; just reading Griffiths helps in getting a good grade. Our midsem was hard, endsem was easier. Quizzes were very easy. Overall, the course was easy.

The course content and teaching method were good; however, the professor was quite strict regarding the labs. His pacing and course knowledge were also very good. However, each lab felt like an exam, making the atmosphere a bit tense. That said, the professor is open to making decisions based on the majority of the class.

Fast paced course.
He completed the syllabus around the midsem and covered so many extra topics including randomized algorithms in detail.
Not so good grading, but nice guy.

His grading was somehow good. He enjoys clearing up doubts.  His lectures are uninteresting, and it was unnecessary to listen to them; simply reading Griffiths will give you good grades , I didn't do that and ended with D..

Excellent professor.
Well curated course curriculum. Quizzes and Mid/End-sem are typical in difficulty. Ideal for getting a theoretical understanding. 

Projects were also interesting (especially 2nd mini project, involving meta learning).

Extremely passionate professor, deeply interested in the subject and attempting his level best at teaching. 8AM classes were a hurdle, making it hard to pay attention. 
Course pacing was weird, sometimes the course sails with JEE level things, while at other times there is a steep learning curve (especially if we're not paying close attention during lectures).
Mini quizzes ensured continuous studying, making mid sem and end sem very manageable.

Really good professor, teaching passionately about the subject. He focused on important concepts, and was receptive to whether the class is following ;).
The course difficulty is what it is, needing a slightly deeper understanding for application of techniques.

The lack of attendance requirement led to diminishing audiences during the semester

The Course is a bit difficult to catch up in the first semester, as its contents are very different from that of JEEðŸ˜
 Nandini Mam wasn't much strict, but one loses interest when not getting much in the class, where the actual downfall starts.ðŸ“‰
Great guy!

Sudhir Misra is a passionate person, but he is stuck in the past. Personally, TA was a fruitless course for me. Attending classes did not help that much. Moreover, TA111 includes labs: 9 paper + 1 AutoCAD iirc. Students with good tutors learnt better and got better grades as well. I don't think any normalization was done between sections. Hope AutoCAD labs are given more weightage (50%) in further years to help students learn what they really need to. Overall, the course was a bad experience.

Enthusiastic professor, however his classes were usually just Griffiths readouts (he even picks jokes from the book ðŸ’€). Tutorials were kinda hard, and often not solved completely. Doing Griffiths (in text questions, optionally the end of chapter ones) was sufficient for a good grade.

Decently difficult course. Handwriting is too good (often not legible but pretty nonetheless).
One grade down compared to other MTHs, ok ish.

Extremely passionate professor, teaches with enthusiasm. Course pace however seemed haphazard, every lecture was very heavy in terms of understanding, taking multiple hours to understand - this is partially due to the nature of quantum, however, better design and slower pace could've been beneficial. For instance, I had to skip a topic before going for mid sem, due to paucity of time.

He's a great prof. He is very passionate and enjoys answering questions during and after lectures.  He started off really well, explaining everything in extensive detail. However, a lot of students disrespected his lectures by running from class. Motivated by that, he made the midterm harder. I wish the student community is better towards profs like him in the future :)
PS: Im leaving this review before endsem, so I cannot comment about anything else.
He's very strict and doesn't care about students
Very monotonous lectures. Bad grading. Course content was also not as interesting as expected. Better oration and more case-study based content might help better this course.
Very lenient prof. Easy quizzes and a moderate midsem and endsem, with questions directly asked from the reference books. Good course if you are ok with memorizing the content.

His teaching style and content is reallyyy good. Keeps the class engaging. Very friendly and for me it was one of the classes where u actually understand the content in the class itself instead of studying later. So... about quizzes and assignments - weekly quizzes and weekly assignments but the grading wasðŸ¤Œso good . Questions in mid and end sem are relatively a little bit tougher than the assignments he gives. He really likes to test our conceptual understanding in the exams and the quizzes

The prof is very good. The quiz and the exam both were solely from what he talked about in the class nothing from the text books or the reading material that he gives, probably it is just for someone who wants to get extra knowledge or deep understanding. The grading was also very easy and the exam and quiz were mcq type only.

The experience was really great. The lectures were super effective and his notes were more than enough for every exam that he conducted. Assignments were discussed well by the tutors and he also provided the solutions. He was always ready for taking up doubts and conducted extra lectures to clear them, which were so helpful.

Really friendly and enthusiastic. His exams were totally based on the content covered in class, though his hand writing and fast paced delivery made it hard to follow sometimes. Exams were mostly not based on assignments and focused a lot on derivations covered in class.

Exams were mostly low scoring and  focused a lot on theory and derivations. Classroom content and assignments were enough for exams, though he didn't share PPTs for the important derivations he used to cover. Gave an innovative video assignment which was fun.

The course was fast paced and very hard to follow. Quizzes and other exams were low scoring as they were not based on the assignments.  Course content was heavy and the grading was pretty bad. He shared his lecture notes.
Delivery of the content was very nice. But his notes didn't cover the important details of the module which made studying for the quiz really hard. Class timings of 8 am made things more difficult.

Bad grading and tough exams doomed me in this course. The assignments were not well discussed and references for the course were not shared which made studying for exams really tough. Delivery of content in class was pretty bad and hard to follow. Had lost all hopes of passing it.
Shared all of his classroom content on his webpage, and exams were based on his lecture notes. Had to avoid silly mistakes in exams, as they were mostly high scoring. Very much related to JEE.

Had the policy of surprise quizzes and used to take 2 quizzes within the span of 5 minutes at a time. Course content was tough but the grading was really great. Expected heavy calculations over calculators, which were not supported by the calculators of many students. Delivery of content in class was not very effective.
His classroom notes were totally based on Griffiths. Provided solutions for tough questions of his tutorial sheets.
Course by its nature required deeper understanding of concepts, though his efforts were commendable to make classes interactive. Grading was terrible considering it was an IC course.
Delivery of content in class is ineffective, as he never interacts and keeps on talking. Quizzes are tough.
Course content was tough and checking of exam sheets was far from lenient. All exams were low scoring apart from the mcq quiz.
Bhai anti-modi, strong minded, will fuck your mind with utmost ethical scenarios, interacts very well
Really good prof

C me kaun karata h 
and such bad handwriting
prof doesn't have a deep understanding of the concepts himself

Sanjay sir is a very good teacher. He knows how to teach physics. Ask anything to him, he won't get angry. He takes weekly HWs and quizes, the quizes are on the easier side and helps to study on weekly basis while HWs are basically free source of marks. His grading is okish..

He has other wordly expectations from you in the exam. Only a few manage to write in the paper exactly what he is expecting and it is not easy. He will ask questions based on class activities and won't share anything else regarding it on hellloIITK/webmail.
Good quality of paper. Harsh grading.

Kind and friendly proff. Maybe it was her first time so teaching was not that consistent, but the content and quality of papers was great nonetheless. 
The course is really mathematical and fun.
Really good prof. But a bit hand wavy.

Is a nice prof, but a bit stricter. Won't allow you to use mobile phones in class, and if you are caught, then get ready for a verbal lashing. Is really very passionate when it comes to Art. Sometimes even gives brownie points (although not sure if it's a summer only thing or not). Expect the difficulty level (of the Question paper) to rise as the sem proceeds.

Most importantly, recognises students who did outstandingly in his courses, and would award them accordingly. I got a Letter of Appreciation :)

A highly enthusiastic prof whose lectures are consistently interesting. The weekly mini-quizzed made sure I stayed up to date on lecture contentsðŸ˜…. Expect mild to moderately challenging major tests but simply paying attention to lectures and revising weekly should get you through these just fine.
Absolute grading, egoistic
Really good prof, puts in effort to teach a class even if only one's listening.

This prof doesn't know what he is teaching, is absolute dogshit at what he does. He can't even produce one proof without looking the solution himself, still claims everything trivial lmao. Kabhi mat lena. Tho grading is better than avg MTH profs.

Absolutely wonderful professor, aisi aisi jagaho pe tumhare casteism realise karayega where you won't ever see by yourself, has great observational skills. Teaches well, exams are not from the readings but from the class content. Grading is good (not as good as Muthukumar obv)
Good professor, has absolute clarity of concepts, would answer your doubt even before you finish saying it. Fun to talk to. Grading is harsh, sometimes pacing of the course was a bit fast.

I would give 6 stars for the pacing if it was possible. An absolute genius in his area but pacing is too fast, even when the content is hard to follow.  Has great clarity, would answer your doubt before you finish saying it. Grading is very harsh.

God level professor, genius in his area, explains concepts with great clarity. I would give 6 stars for the lecture quality if possible. 

 But he's impatient, will call you an idiot for asking silly doubts, won't entertain regrading requests (but tbf the checking was flawless). Grading is average (by MTH standards).
Goated prof, makes absolutely delightful question papers and assignments (mostly original). Classes were hard to follow, I had to study mostly on my own. Grading is average.

Good prof, puts efforts in class, but seems dumb (Says she'll make the toughest assignment possible and then is absolutely shocked when half the class get full lmao, this is one of the major reasons her grading is vv good.) 
Follows procedure to the letter, very strict.  Would not entertain if you f'ed something up, gives straightaway zero.

Dogshit professor. Doesn't know what he teaches, can't explain shit for his life but still has the audacity to give grades equivalent to Ganguly lmao. Kabhi mat lena.
Bro gave C+ at 70% marks and A at 80% marks, 3 A's, 0 B+, 1B in a class of 80+ lmfaooooo
Make you learn how to think. He will make you love the subject and if you need regular wow moments, this course is great
This course was the mkst thrilling course apart from PHY114. Very great enthusiasm and very great professor
The course was very tough over which the quizzes and exams were too difficult. Though the grading was pretty good.
The professor teaches well in class. His lecture slides were also good and assignments also helped in quizzes and exams.
Prof teaches good classes are interactive but would only understand the course if you go to classes regularly, the grading is decent gave around 45 A in a batch of 250 and some more B and B +.
Drop the course, does extremely bad grading

Really well conducted course, surprise quizzes kept you on the edge and continuously preparing, while not remaining stressful. Grading was GREAT and actually was somewhat interested in electronics by the end of it :)

One of the best profs I have encountered here. He teaches extremely well and is clearly passionate about teaching which is quite rare to find. One of the very few or only course that I actually attended all lectures even without any attendance criteria. His board work was of also extremely good quality and overall was one of my best experience with a course.
He will give you good wibes in the course but grading is very very harsh
I have taken this course as an OE. He is a great man, very friendly. I don't know why people in the class were so less. Minimum grade he gives is c+.
Good grading and easy midsem - endsem exams

During the first few classes, he simply kept writing on the board (I assume he wanted to finish the book he is working on in silence). He starts interacting with the class only after at least the first 5 classes idk why. Moreover, the classes post midterm, were much more interesting and easier. He tells us that his methods, inspired from his time in Russia, are much simpler than the ones generally taught. To some extent, that might be true. Overall, good experience. PS: haven't gotten grades yet but seniors say he does B centric
One of the most insightful, patient, humble, and straightforward professors in mechanical department.
Very good and approachable professor. Fun course.

One of the best professors here in the Mech dept. Took our first mechanical DC (and probably the most important one, considering the number of other DCs where it is a prereq). He used to solve every question till completion and never asked us to do it on our own (even the smallest of (and/or largest) vector calculations. The only thing is that the course itself is a little lengthy in the sense that it can get a bit annoying, having to solve the questions in a limited time. Quizzes were always doable and on the easier side (bi-weekly). Midsem and endsem were a bit tough, but honestly, I had not done any written practice and just scrolled through the solutions each time. A little practice would have definitely guaranteed an A (I was avg in both mid sem and endsem, the quizzes carried me). At the end of the course I was at 60-65% while the average was 50%, got a B+. Overall, top tier prof for sure.
He was very nice it was a small class and we were able to grasp it easily very good grading

Drop it , don't take it  , Grading and content is real nightmare bcos he expects u to mug up every word of 6 to 7 and nearly 32 pages each documents. He sends slides only a one or two days prior to quiz or exam only upon numerous requests.

Great teacher. Carefully takes care of doubts from students. He has some strict rules and absolute grading. Apart from that he's a very enthusiastic teacher and his tests actually evaluate whether you've listened to him in class or not.
She seems not at all interested in teaching. She just reads out slides.
Great professor.
Monotonous lectures. Bad grading.

Way too passionate about his times in Russia. Loves yapping about everything unrelated to the course, like how he doesn't need medicines, and god knows what-all. Just keeps writing on the board, and clicks pictures of the board work. Seems robotic. Have heard he grades well.
Very passionate prof. Loved his classes. Notes hard to understand if you don't attend classes though.
He took this course for the first time and his content knowledge was great. Weekly mini quizzes really helped to keep up with the course content, although it may seem frustrating at the start.

Has good knowledge regarding the course, but definitely isn't the friendliest of profs. While he does clear doubts when asked and all, but it is just his Aura in class that makes everyone petrified of him.
Teaching is good but grading is bad
His lectures are boring. He sets tough quiz but easy end sem exams
Friendly proff and good teaching
The major problem is that his grading is very disproportionate...in the class of 1200 he gives 2-3 A, 10-11 B+ and B..and the major chuck lies below C+.....
If you're an MSE student currently taking PHY114 under him, then you have my deepest sympathies.
You will have a very wonderful experience...
Very good prof but expectations are very high especially from EE and CSE student...I have Done this course as EME...The exams are very tough...
Very friendly and enthusiastic professor. Loves to interact with students and encourages discussions in class. Lectures are easy to follow.
Lectures can be hard to follow as understanding what he's trying to convey is difficult
Can be somewhat strict regarding course policies. But other than that very nice prof. Loves to interact with students. Lectures are also super organized and do not feel redundant
Stickler for his rules of writing of answers in his way. Lashed out at some students. A very poor first experience for students that just started their higher education.
The lectures were very helpful.
Very enthusiastic professor and lectures were just the right pace.
Good and enthusiastic teacher, but too many quizzes/assignments/activities. Also grading was found bad by overall consensus of students.
Very informative and easy to follow lectures. The tests and exams were also good and taken with proper breathing space in between though they could have been lesser in number.
Very interesting lectures and enthusiastic professor. CE261 Labs however were not pleasant.
Plagued by too many assignments. The course workload was untenable. The lectures were fine but often monotone.
The classes were absolutely unhelpful, monotone. You have to teach yourself, lectures were useless.
Just awesome prof who won't let your energy down in class. Grading was great.
taught pretty well, could be quite fast paced at sometimes but the course demanded that,  made exams of good difficulty level but the checking was lenient, the course average was low around 37-40
found the lecture experience boring he would just keep going on and on from the slides, grading of mso205 was pretty bad but did good grading for mth212, exam checking is harsh
Kind of okayish prof. Takes 4-5 objective quizzes but endsem midsem pure subjective. Avg goes high in quizzes but reduces drastically in endsem. Can get A easily just above a aggregate score of 60
Excellent teaching but course content is rushed
Very friendly Professor... discussed many things beyond the course content like existence of God, necessity of religion etc..
Great Professor... Grading is awesome though exam questions are slightly tough.. Very friendly... Chill Professor.. Truly enjoyed the class
Best prof in che, most friendly, best in grading and very liberal while correcting copies.

It will always be a great experience to have worked with Professor Vyas. He is an excellent mentor, balancing professionalism and personalisation. His work ethics are very remarkable and inspiring. His experience and expertise speak for themselves whenever he guided us through nitty gritty details of work, and never failed to enlighten us through every solution we arrived at after discussing with him. In one of our very early interactions only I learned something big: I stumbled across a problem and said "Sir ye thora mushkil hai", he only said to me "IITians don't say that".
gradeortopic: Digital Twin development for a novel energy storage process

review: A very good prof because whole semester no effort required, just a last day mugging of some slides will give you A/B+ easily. Attendance is there but can go after logging on the machine. Very soft spoken and friendly, never questions anyone in class.
Grading is not fair in his course

Not a good experience at all. Personally the teaching style seems very unprofessional, and he never has good pacing. Wastes time less important things and rushed through important parts in the end, in the end the syllabus remains incomplete. Assignments are of poor quality, many a times containing out of syllabus questions. Very casual in conversations in students.

Bhai matlab quizzes/endsem/midsem ke pehle 1-2 din me chapters nipta deta tha... dhang ka padhata nhi tha. Also grading toh gandi thi hi....
Midsem/Endsem easy the which i fucked up, thats my fault though....

Best professor ever, very friendly, courses are a bit difficult in the sense that you have to read the materials and understand it but feel free to drop by her office and she will help you a lot

P.S. I remember i met her outside class hours for discussion more than 15 times in the whole semester
Very easy course, just mugging few slides a day before but not good at giving A grade although almost 70% class gets over B, so a safe EME and less effort giving.
A noble professor... I once forgot to submit an assignment file, and even though he wasnâ€™t obliged to, he personally emailed me to submit. Itâ€™s really sad to see heâ€™s leaving IIT K forever.

God prof, knowledge>>> 
Model theory mera thora sir ke upar se gya tha... par not Sir's fault. Yes I asked stupid doubts so he did scold me often...But yes very interesting prof.

The OG prof, very friendly and effort giving but expects same from students. Open notes exam, experimental and simulation labs, so course is very very effort heavy but one of the nicest of profs in che so course doesn't feel very tough.
Worst prof, oblivious to innovative ideas in course projects and doesnt even understand them. Avoid, if dc then attend classes and be friendly with him to get good grades
Grading was not that good
Enthusiastic prof but very judgemental and bad in grading, A at avg+1.5 sd, though sometimes give PYQs in mid and endsem. Okayish and avoid his DE theology :)

Spends the first 10 minutes of each class asking doubts, recalling what was done previously, pacing was fast but the content he covered was amazing. Like I dont think any other instructor will do the full proof of Jordan Holder's thm (and ask it in the exam ;)). 
But yes too good conceptually, really enjoyed his classes regardless of what grade i end up getting.
Hell of a course he made for us, was good in grading one year before but don't know why got frustrated with our batch. Avoid avoid

This prof is one of the worst profs.  that a fresher could get, throughout the sem had a strict attendance policy of 90 percentage and scrapped it when the session was towards the end and then also did not share the exact lecture notes of class(he shared different notes,which were did not match to the content that taught in class).

He did C+ centric grading...
Same as Aaryan, bhai i went to his office hours once to ask something and left feeling more confused.
Great Prof and generally good grading. Course content is pretty useful and interesting, he is really enthusiastic as well. Some people may find the course overwhelming
Tests are very frequent that makes the course difficult... The course content is also not so easy..
Sir is very good very friendly crack jokes
Really great person!
Prof is extremely great guy, liked his teaching.
One of the best profs i have met and it was a privilege to get a course under him.
Explains complex concepts clearly and makes the subject engaging. His teaching style is structured, supportive, and encourages critical thinking.
Great grading with a major focus on implementation using assignments and open notes examinations. Although the course can sometimes get too technical for some people's liking.
Good professor. Nice and friendly guy. Good teaching. And grading will be good if students respect the professor and attend class.
iske course lene se accha, mera le lo
Decent B+ centric grading, but boring course.

Sabse bekaar professor mechanical ka. Kya padhata hai use hi nahi pata. Even he takes time to derive simple algebraic derivations. Negative teaching skills. Worst exam patter and question. Gives assignment just before endsem.

This proff is the worst for Subject like ESC. Level of difficult vary absurdly for different sections. Like we have mainly two sections Tuesday and Friday section.  Question of lab exam for Friday section was very easy and for Tuesday section was quit difficult and lengthy.  But still he didn't normalize the marks or grade Tuesday section separately.

If you ever get him in a course, you are done for. Did very well in exams, still got a C, infact most of the class got C or D. The professor teaches well, and classes seem to go very well, but his grading is C+ centric, which might concern you. (slightly low rating as grading is what matters after all)

Highly recommended for PG students looking to score good. The grades had always been great in PG courses (ME659) (ME672) (ME662) (ME661). However, the opinions are mixed for UG courses from the same Prof. Just follow the lectures and take notes, you have a solid B+.
Nice

Most amazing professor whose only goal is to teach and spread knowledge

Best prof in each and everything. Solutions for the assignment were detailed. Explanation was top notch, he made every difficult topic simple and easy. Quizzes were purely based on assignments and were easy to score. Midsem and endsem were slightly on tougher side. Awesome professor.

A very humble professor who makes the course content easy to digest

Brilliant teaching methods and very passionate about teaching. But if you struggle in his course, the grades will be much harsher.

Lectures are little bit boring but contents are good.
Grading policy is quite fine. if you study well then you can easily get B+ or A grade.

My research topic is L-DED in Additive Manufacturing under Arvind Sir (Thesis Supervisor). He is friendly in nature and very helpful. He provided the research topics himself and related research papers to students under him so they can choose the intrest area accordingly.
His work is more oriented to simulation (using openfoam ) rather than experimental.
He is among few who takes pride in teaching. He just want students to learn and understand whatever course he/she is involved into.

Covered everything under the sun of 5G wireless technologies in a very meticulous manner. Both enthusiasm and pacing were perfect. Grading has been very justified and the overall course difficulty has been reduced only through the way he delivers and makes things easier to understand.

The way this course was taught has been quite underwhelming. Most of the time, formulas were just written down without any explanation of where they came from or what they mean. It made it hard to follow along or build any real understanding of the subject. The lectures often felt all over the place, and the slides used looked outdated and didnâ€™t help in making the content any clearer.
The grading system was extremely strict. Even small things like a minor rounding difference could lead to a huge cut in marks. It felt unfair at times, especially when the focus seemed to be more on memorizing and copying what's on the slides than actually understanding the topic.
There wasnâ€™t much helpful feedback either. If you made a mistake, you didnâ€™t get to learn what went wrong â€” just lost marks with no explanation. It honestly felt like we were expected to be error-free, which isnâ€™t realistic. Unless you're okay with this kind of teaching and grading style, it might be better to think twice before taking this course, or at least audit it if your supervisor say its compulsory

One of the finest teachers on campus. Prof Harbola taught the Quantum Mechanics course which has been by far the best course I took at IITK. Iâ€™ve done two courses with Suchitra maâ€™am- Feminist Theory and Responsible Dissent. The way she teaches is that weâ€™re given a reading before class, and then the class itself is just an open discussion and analysis of that reading. Both times, the class size was really small (less than 10 people), so it was easy to speak up and have a discussion. There were assignments given every week, but we only had to submit a fixed number of those. And alongside that, we worked on a term paper throughout the semester on a topic of our choosing. There were no exams. The texts were a bit challenging to understand at times, but maâ€™am always encouraged us to come see her if anything was unclear after class. I learned a lot from both courses. They were structured really well, and maâ€™am is clearly very knowledgeable about the subjects. Plus, sheâ€™s great at teaching it. Iâ€™d definitely recommend her courses to anyone interested in these topics.

A very knowledgeable and supportive professor, always well-prepared for lectures, and encourages student participation, excellent teacher with a deep understanding of the subject. Most importantly, the grading is fair and transparent.

The professor taught the lecture very well, clearly explaining how practical experiments relate to the theory.
